name: Kepler-402
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-402 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-402 is a star with 1.5739999999999998 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.26 times its radius. It is located 2076.90 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-402 is known to have 4 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-402 b

Kepler-402 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.03 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-402.

The mass of Kepler-402 b is 1.56 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-402 b is 1.22 that of Earth. At 1.56 Earth masses, Kepler-402 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-402 c

Kepler-402 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 6.12 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-402.

The mass of Kepler-402 c is 2.79 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-402 c is 1.56 that of Earth. At 2.79 Earth masses, Kepler-402 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

The mass of Kepler-402 d is 2.08 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-402 d is 1.38 that of Earth. At 2.08 Earth masses, Kepler-402 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 11.24 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-402.

description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-402, which contains 4 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
